sentences.en: Children would write valedictory speeches about KP 2.
sentences.cn: 孩子们将会为KP2写段告别词.

sentences.en: Mr. Walker made his valedictory address after two years as chairman.
sentences.cn: 在担任主席职务两年后，沃克先生发表了告别演说。

sentences.en: Next, it is broad farmer milepost of valedictory of tradition of Xiang Shiju bungalow.
sentences.cn: 其次, 它是广大农民向世居平房传统离别的里程碑.

sentences.en: Select kidneys and maintenance, so that my energy away from the valedictory lackadaisical days of fatigue!
sentences.cn: 选择肾部保养, 让自己精力充沛,远离疲劳告别无精打采的日子!

sentences.en: The student with the highest academic rank in a class who delivers the valedictory at graduation.
sentences.cn: 在毕业典礼上致告别词的最好级别的学生.

sentences.en: This valedictory dispatch was written as he retired from the foreign service a few weeks ago.
sentences.cn: 这份告别报告是他几周前从外交界退休时所写的.

words.tran_cn: 告别演说者；致告别辞者

trans.tran_cn: （尤在正式场合）告别的，告辞的
trans.tran_en: A valedictory speech, letter, or performance is one that is intended as a way of saying goodbye when someone leaves another person, a place, or a job
a speech or statement in which you say goodbye when you are leaving a school, job etc, especially on a formal occasion
